meanings.definition: Equipped or protected with a complete set of armor or weapons.
meanings.sent1: The knight stood panoplied in shining armor.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers marched into battle panoplied and ready.
meanings.sent3: The cat felt panoplied in its fluffy fur, ready to face the cold.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline was panoplied with glittering lights at night.
meanings.sent5: The garden was panoplied with colorful flowers, creating a beautiful display.

meanings.sent1: The queen entered the room panoplied in her royal attire.
meanings.sent2: The chef was panoplied with all the necessary tools for cooking.
meanings.sent3: The students felt panoplied with knowledge after studying hard.
meanings.sent4: The forest was panoplied with a variety of wildlife and plants.
meanings.sent5: The stage was panoplied with props for the upcoming play.
